entry.title: viz: Fix perfect cadance calculation
entry.content:
Use nanoseconds when measuring the remainder for the perfect cadence

calculations, so we do not unintentionally truncate the vsync values.

Prior to this fix, if vsync_interval was 16.66ms and

begin_frame_interval_ was 50ms, we would get a remainder of 2 instead of

a remainder of 0.02, and thus we would unintentionally not throttle

certain framesinks.



Bug: b/291797476

Change-Id: I9cbeda01ba3ef39abebe7038280e8274d78e0ebc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753320

Reviewed-by: Jonathan Ross

Commit-Queue: Navin Ramsaroop

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180651}

entry.title: [Extensions UI] Fix count discrepancy for allSites page and dialog
entry.content:
This CL fixes the extensions count discrepancy between the allSites page

and the edit site permissions dialog for the "customize per extension"

option.



It achieves this by:

- only counting enabled extensions in both places

- Changing the GetExtensionGrantedPermissions method to look at

active permissions for policy installed extensions instead of

looking in extensions prefs for granted permissions

- Using GetExtensionGrantedPermissions in the dialog, for consistency



Bug: 1468142

entry.title: [LCPP] Ensure LCPP data is initialized before recording new data
entry.content:
Before this CL, we missed the check for `initialization_state_` before

recording new LCPP signal to the database, resulting in null deref of

`lcpp_data_`.



This CL ensures that the database is initialized before writing data to

it.

entry.title: [Panorama][GM3] Update default colors for custom color picker
entry.content:
* Set no background-color and foreground-color for the default

customColor, which causes the circle to be hidden since the fallback

within cr-theme-color is an skColor value of 0.

* Have the default color for the eyedropper icon follow the theme.



Note: the default color for both the icon and the background of the

swatch only shows if a custom color was not selected when the side panel

is opened. The last color selected stays there for the whole session

once one has been in the custom color picker.

entry.title: [dPWA] Deflake TrackParentWindowDestructionBeforeViewCreation
entry.content:
While investigating the WebAppUninstallDialogViewBrowserTest flake, it

was noticed that UninstallWithNoBrowserWindow was testing the same

exact thing, i.e. destruction of the parent window that triggered the

uninstallation would not cause an UAF.



The old test was also a remnant of the old logic, where setting up the

dialog view component and the dialog triggerer itself were 2 separate

classes, and it was simpler to delete a window in the middle of that

process. Right now, since everything is synchronously triggered, this

use case can no longer happen, and thus the uninstall with no browser

window test can be used to test the same thing.



Bug: 1467782

Change-Id: I39619695981d14e55ef48d8f97176b08f67e81c9

entry.title: Fix ExtensionLocalizationThrottle::WillProcessResponse
entry.content:
Synchronous call of `delegate_->CancelWithError()` inside

blink::URLLoaderThrottle::WillProcessResponse() in Blink can cause UAF.

To fix this, this CL change ExtensionLocalizationThrottle::

WillProcessResponse() to set `defer` to true, and asynchronously call

`delegate_->CancelWithError()`.



Bug: 1469754

entry.title: Add Component Updater support for Widevine on ChromeOS Ash
entry.content:
This enables ChromeOS Ash to use a component updated Widevine CDM, if

one is available. Like Linux the CDM must be loaded at boot time, so a

new CDM is simply registered and will be loaded next time the device

restarts.



The update is deployed as a disk image, so it needs to be mounted first

in order to access the files. As well, at boot time the disk image must

be mounted, so this depends on an init script running on ChromeOS to

mount the image (if available) at boot time so that Chrome startup can

access the new CDM.



Tested on a ChromeOS device by manually changing the version of the CDM

bundled, and then verifying that a newer version is downloaded and used

next time the device is rebooted.



Bug: b/223462652

Test: see above

Change-Id: I674e9c3760b627ffa142b410d0982b5503ee7ac4

entry.title: Settings Split: Remember known imposters for input device settings
entry.content:
When a keyboard goes from being marked as an imposter to being not

marked, it's device key gets stored in prefs so that it does not need to

utilize the imposter checking in the future. In these cases, it completely skips over the standard imposter checking provided by evdev.

entry.title: Acquire a graph lock when clearing AudioListenerHandler
entry.content:
When clearing `handler_` in AudioListener, it needs to have a graph

lock because the process will clear out AudioParamHandler members in

`handler_`. See the pattern of AudioNode destrcutor:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/webaudio/audio_node.cc;l=57?q=audio_node.cc

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Update max queue size to 5
entry.content:
As part of our ongoing investigation into CPU and power consumption with

the bulk pinning feature, it was identified that a queue size of 5 would

be ideal to launch with. Then we should experiment with the queue size

being updated via a finch feature param.



This pref was introduced in M117 so currently has only rolled out to

dev / canary. So far folks using this pref have been limited to the

Files team testing the queue size functionality.

entry.title: Clamp scroll end offset, specifically for continuous overview animation.
entry.content:
We are supposed to clamp the scrolls before entering

`Handle3FingerContinuousVerticalScroll`. We can then check if

`scroll_y == kVerticalThresholdDp` to determine if we can skip this

scroll event.



Not clamping the offset for a scroll end was causing the ending

animation to be triggered more than once.

entry.title: [GM3] Record set GM3 color
entry.content:
Adds the ChromeColors.DynamicColorOnLoad histogram to track the

installed GM3 color. This histogram works similarly to the existing

ChromeColors.ColorOnLoad histogram, which tracks GM2 colors. We have

decided to add a new histogram instead of tracking more colors in the

existing one because:

* GM2 and GM3 colors are defined in separate places, and sharing IDs

across both definitions became convoluted.

* The plan is to deprecate GM2 colors. Once, that happens we can cleanly

remove the existing histogram and all associated color definitions and

IDs.



In order to still track how users migrate from GM2 to GM3 colors, this

CL adds the ChromeColors.ColorType histogram, which simply logs whether

the user has a GM2 or GM3 color installed.

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix service worker event dispatch metric emitting logic.
entry.content:
Regarding metrics:

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionEventPage

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionServiceWorker

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckLongTime.ExtensionServiceWorker



Two issues are fixed here:



1) The .DeepCopy() for Event was not copying the dispatch_start_time and

causing the metrics to have the wrong value.

2) EventRouter::DispatchEventToSender() is now excluded from these

metrics as it is a different flow than

EventRouter::DispatchEventImpl(). Specifically it is past when a

service worker has been started so it was measuring a different value.



This means that the metrics are accurately measuring event dispatch

time, but no longer includes those going through

EventRouter::DispatchEventToSender(). Including that flow will be

considered in a follow-up change.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=incremented

DispatchToAckTime/DispatchToAckLongTime.ExtensionServiceWorker and

DispatchToAck.ExtensionEventPage due to mostly inaccurate recorded data.



Change-Id: I12410383f643f37bd32781697167586b990b39e2

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh] expand kHitTest tab path to take entire horizontal space
entry.content:
... as well as some other path fixes for small tabs.



For Tab Hover effects, in GM2 Tab Style, there was a continuous hover when moving the mouse across tabs. In ChromeRefresh2023, the separator margin became wider, which caused the hit test to have dead space in the middle of the tabs. This caused the hover effect to go away when mousing over the separator. In order to fix this we expand the hit test all of the way into the separator.



The same goes for the detatched tab paths if they are very small.

entry.title: URL: Measure setting a non-special scheme on a special scheme URL
entry.content:
Chrome currently allows setting a non-special scheme on a special

schema URL. This is not compliant with the URL standard.



Example:



const url = new URL("https://example.com/");

url.protocol = "non-special";

// url.href should be "https://example.com/",

// but it became "non-special://example.com/"



To address this interoperability issue, we need to assess the impact

of fixing it.



This is in preparation of the main CL [1] and Intent to Ship, which

will be sent.



[1]: https://crrev.com/c/4744799

entry.title: [content] Update web preferences for ColorProvider changes
entry.content:
Currently there are web preferences such as prefers-color-scheme

that depend on ColorProvider state. ColorProviders associated with

a WebContents may change independently of NativeTheme changes.



This CL propagates web preference updates on a ColorProvider change

to cover this case. This is gated on the existence of the current

frame host as the change notification may be called early in the

WebContents' lifecycle before this has been set.



Fixed a broken SystemWebDialogTest that was making assertions on

WebPreferences before the dialog had committed its navigation. Prior

to this the code below [1] was being called with an empty URL and the

expected preference overrides were not applied as expected.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:chrome/browser/chromeos/tablet_mode/chrome_content_browser_client_tablet_mode_part.cc;l=108;drc=6caa502482a4a9dacee0574a7dc820fdc5a79d76

entry.title: Refactor Device Lock MVC to make selected account optional.
entry.content:
Originally, inSignInFlow was passed to the Device Lock UI to help distinguish between flows related to sign-in and flows that aren't, such as autofill. This explicit variable is no longer needed, since the same information is conveyed by passing in the selected account - this change also allows the selected account to be null, to indicate that a flow is not related to sign-in and doesn't need to trigger the reauthentication challenge.

of ShouldOfferOptIn() so that we can log to the correct bucket (break

down by local card and virtual card) when auth is started/completed.

in dialog's metric.

flow

entry.title: HTTPS-First Mode: Implement Typically Secure User heuristic
entry.content:
This CL implements a new heuristic to automatically enable

HTTPS-First Mode called Typically Secure User. In this heuristic, we

check if the user is visiting mainly HTTPS sites after HTTPS-Upgrades

is enabled by default. If the user visits a site that doesn't support

HTTPS, HTTPS-Upgrades feature will fall back to HTTP and we'll record

a persistent entry for this fallback event. If the user has a small

number of fallback events recorded over a one week window (along with

other checks such as old enough profile age), we'll automatically

enable HTTPS-First Mode toggle in the UI.



Bug: 1469343

Change-Id: I29d87ddc80b1649186593847884439d0a64c68b0

entry.title: Disabled night light button in the lock/sign in screen
entry.content:
This CL disables the night light button in the lock screen and sign-in

screen. For the sign-in screen, the user preference hasn't been set yet,

so we don't know the state for the night light settings. For the lock

screen, since the night light feature pod isn't enabled in the legacy

Qs bubble, we inherited this behavior and made the night light feature

tile invisible. But this introduced confusion for the users since the

night light toggle button on the main page worked, but the tile didn't

show in the display subpage. So we made it consistent by disabling the

night light button on the main page. In the following bug(b/294868714),

we will fix this issue for good by adding the night light feature tile

in the display subpage and enable the night light toggle in the main

page.



Screen recording:

sign-in screen:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6a8TuchKRPYL4J9



lock screen:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3KM4bnDA5uSb4QV

for tasks and classroom glanceables UI, and sets accessibility roles for

task/coursework lists, and list items. Overrides the task view buttons

(used to mark tasks as complete) to appear as checkboxes to automation

to user changing active list selection (to give feedback to the user

when the task/assignment list selector gets focused, so the users get

a better sense of the UI state when the glanceable bubble gets focused.

entry.title: [GM3] Fix tab alert contrast with tab strip
entry.content:
Fixed issue with the tab strip tab alert colors where the audio playing

icon is dark when using the dark customize chrome theme.



This bug occurs when the chrome-refresh-2023 flag is enabled but the

chrome-web-ui-refresh-2023 flag is disabled. This causes the color

pipeline to use the GM2 definition of the audio playing color which

is defined to contrast with the hover card background color

rather than the tab strip background color. In the case where

chrome-web-ui-refresh-2023 is disabled, the hover card background color

doesn't react to theme changes so there will be a mismatch with tab

strip and hover card background color. As such, the hover card alert

colors will need to use a slightly different definition than the tab

strip alert colors.



Fixed: 1469589

Change-Id: I4ab2426549d5277a53bbf2753cabd3eaa95f437c

entry.title: mediapipe: converts usage of protobuf Any to AnyLite
entry.content:
Directly using Any is chrome code is problematic for the

following reasons:



. In Chrome we use the lite variant of protobuf.

. Chrome includes the generated code for Any using the full version.



The easiest work around is to rename Any, which this patch does.



To make this slightly trickier the protobuf compiler special

cases Any. Specifically, the protobuf compiler generates additional

functions for Any. mediapipe uses these functions, so that renaming

the proto is not enough.



This patch includes the generated source files with the additional

functions that the compiler generates for Any.

entry.title: [A11y] Form controls mode must not load inline text boxes
entry.content:
Enforced via DCHECKs (not worth using CHECK since this potentially runs multiple times per node, and there isn't value in more testing of something that would break in CQ in debug builds).



1. Don't load inline textboxes on Android during form controls mode. A

change had to be made to some code that force loaded inline textboxes in

editable subtrees.

2. Don't allow changes to the AXMode once set for a dump tree test. The

AXMode in content_browsertests was previously getting trounced. A

DisallowAXModeChanges() method has been added to

BrowserAccessibilityState. This in turn led to a simplification of the

BrowserAccessibilityStateImpl code that handles forced AXModes.

3. Remove the VirtualTestSuite for form controls mode, as a web test can

load the AccessibilityController, which is unaware of the command line

and will trounce the AXMode. Instead, turn these into

content_browsertests.



Fixed: 1470833

Change-Id: I8e2331681ac98cb35888f0711aa59c2cff838e03

entry.title: [GM3 motion]Phase 3: update easing and motion of message animations
entry.content:
Sliding up:

Before: a message moves outside of the screen while it becomes

transparent.



After: a message shrinks and keep moving until its top side reaches

the top edge of the screen. At the same time, the content becomes

transparent.



Sliding horizontally:

Before: a message becomes 100% transparent generally.

After: only the content becomes transparent and new animation allows

the message to slide until it is out of the screen.



One exception:

when the user drags the message upwards, it doesn't shrink and is

still allowed to drag out of the screen. After it is released,

it starts shrinking.



This CL uses ViewOutlineProvider to create a round-corner rectangle

to clip the message view to simulate the height change in order

to avoid triggering re-layout.



Demo (5x): https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fZD7EZAUtMMxPqsxswGpfSoeCdbJFmsR/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-ZxY9iQ0MOswPQhfuB2pkCA



Bug: 1464729

entry.title: Fix bug where CSBRRs do not get send when user closes tab
entry.content:
When the user closes the tab on the interstitial, the ThreatDetails are

destroyed, so the CSBRR was not getting sent. This CL remedies that by

having the TriggerManager populate and send the report with the

available fields of information (url, type, url_request_destination,

did_proceed, repeat_visit, and interstitial_interactions). Unrelated to

this, I added an enum value CMD_REQUEST_SITE_ACCESS_PERMISSION to the

csd proto because it was causing build errors.



Bug: 1315455

entry.title: [blinkpy] Remove references to trusty
entry.content:
No-op change to remove the `trusty` version identifier from web tests.

The Linux port is now simply referred to as the versionless `linux`,

since it seems unlikely we will ever test against more than one Linux

version at a time, and this avoids naming churn for future upgrades.



There's no need to rename the `test-linux-{trusty,precise}` ports, since

those aren't implemented by the real `LinuxPort`.



Fixed: 1468322

ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter that is not keyed by BrowserContext.

instance.

entry.title: Update reporting unit tests to not use base::RunLoop
entry.content:
This change updates some reporting unit tests to not use base::RunLoop

directly when waiting for asynchronous signals as part of ChromeOS code

health efforts. Instead, we use base::test::TestFuture or

test::TestEvent. This change also enables the TaskRunnerContext unit

tests which were not running because they were not being built with the

components_unittests target.

entry.title: Set selected_challenge_option field for OTP unmask card request
entry.content:
With email OTP introduced as a challenge option for VCN retrieval, Orchestration doesn't have the ability to differentiate email OTP versus SMS OTP in the second GetRealPan call. In order to enhance the Orchestration metrics, pass selected_challenge_option field to Orchestration for OTP unmask card request.

entry.title: Reland "Add MirroringStats to cast-feedback"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit b50678de61bd0468b0d7efcf886278727a1cbad8



The original change was reverted because it led to the failure of the

test MediaToolbarButtonContextualMenuTest.ExecuteReportIssueCommand.

I was not aware of this test before, and commit queue did not catch it.

entry.title: Fenced Frames: Add unittest for requestedSize in reportResult().
entry.content:
Previously, there was only a unittest to confirm that requestedSize was

handed to scoreAd() properly. However, reportResult()

will presumably receive the same auctionConfig as scoreAd(), so requestedSize

entry.title: Fix indentation and remove initialization of const struct members
entry.content:
* Fixing incorrect indentation with `git cl format`, crbug/1470846, from

OCL crrev/1180443.

* Remove init of const struct members: @thestig@chromium.org made a very

good point that it's better to not initialize const struct members:

"Since the struct members are const, the compile will fail if the

instantiating code forgets to initialize the struct. By initializing in

the definition, that allows instatiatating the struct without any

arguments, which IMO masks a mistake in this case."



Bug: 1470370

look them up and subscribe to changes as needed.

entry.title: [LoginDatabase::AddLogin] Error and not crash if invalid non-empty URL
entry.content:
The new test LoginDatabaseTest.AddLoginWithNonEmptyInvalidURL would

hit a NOTREACHED in GURL::spec() before this CL. Now

AddCredentialError::kConstraintViolation is returned.

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/password_manager/core/browser/login_database.cc;l=226;drc=bc402fa8e303a969978d2c969fa298543e80529b



Note the same validation is not done for signon_realm, which can be

arbitrary.

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4756559/comment/d8a1a910_95575bd9/
